items.title: New Website!
items.content_html: Every few years I grow tired of my website and build a new one. Here's what I did this time.

items.content_html: WSL is a powerful tool. Learn how to install it.

items.content_html: This is how I figure out my feelings about my current role.

items.content_html: A recap of my first year at DigitalOcean.

items.content_html: A quick little test to see if I want to use Flask or Django.

items.title: Tech Industry Interviews are Bullshit. Let's Make Them Better
items.content_html: We all hate them. Why are they like this?

items.content_html: My thoughts on what I like and don't like to see on resumes.

items.content_html: A Recap of My Second Year at DigitalOcean.

items.content_html: My process for writing conference talk proposals.

items.title: Oh Shit, I Haven't Blogged in a While
items.content_html: Buckle up, I'm going to catch up on two years of blogging in this post.

items.title: 2023 Is Dead! Long Live 2024!
items.content_html: A recap on what I've been up to in 2023 and my goals for 2024.

items.title: You Don't Get Better Without Deliberate Practice
items.content_html: Musicians practice, doctors study, tradespeople fix things around the house. So why do software engineers think they don't need to practice? Reality check, they do.

items.title: Building Docs like Code: Continuous Integration for Documentation
items.content_html:
Building Docs like Code: Continuous Integration for Documentation

This talk discusses why developers dislike writing documentation, what we can do to address this, and provides a ready to go pipeline for automating your documtation

items.title: DigitalOcean Tech Talks
items.content_html:
DigitalOcean Tech Talks

During my time at DigitalOcean I presented multiple Tech Talks live for the community. This is the comprehensive list of talks I gave

items.title: Write Docs Devs Love: Ten Tricks to Level Up Your Tech Writing
items.content_html:
Write Docs Devs Love: Ten Tricks to Level Up Your Tech Writing

You're read good tutorials, you've read bad tutorials. In this talk I'll discuss 10 tips and tricks to level up your technical writing.

items.title: pfSense - A Beginner's Guide to a Sensible Firewall
items.content_html:
pfSense - A Beginner's Guide to a Sensible Firewall

This talk was given at Texas Linux Fest 2016. Co-founder of pfSense Chris Buechler was present in the audience. No pressure.

items.title: Python 102: Beyond the Basics
items.content_html:
Python 102: Beyond the Basics

In this Workshop, you will go beyond the basics of Python and explore various language features that make Python pythonic.

items.title: A Year Without Pants: Strategies for Successful Remote Work
items.content_html:
A Year Without Pants: Strategies for Successful Remote Work

Remote work can be challenging. In this talk I'll discuss different strategies for increasing your productivity and enjoyment of remote work.

items.title: SLI's, SLA's and SL'D'OHS! Learning about Service Uptime from Homer Simpsons
items.content_html:
SLI's, SLA's and SL'D'OHS! Learning about Service Uptime from Homer Simpsons

Measuring service uptime can be a daunting task, but not for the Simpsons! Viewers will leave with a clearer understanding of how to account for services, how SLxs can define and guide what to monitor, and how to implement reliability targets and error budgets; all told by fabled Springfield wisdom

items.title: There's a Snake in the Birdhouse! Building a Python Culture at Vrbo
items.content_html:
There's a Snake in the Birdhouse! Building a Python Culture at Vrbo

We all love Python, but not everyone is fortunate enough to use it at their day job. Come and listen as I detail the journey I took to establish Python as an onroad option at my company. Viewers will leave having learned from my experiences—both successes and mistakes—and with a solid plan for implementing Python at their job.
